com.stormpath.sdk.application

Interface AccountStoreHolder<T extends AccountStoreHolder>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Application, Organization

    public interface AccountStoreHolder<T extends AccountStoreHolder>
    Interface to be implemented by Resources capable of storing account stores. For example: Applications and Organizations.
    Since:
    1.0.RC7

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AccountStore getDefaultAccountStore()
      Returns the AccountStore (either a Group, a Directory or an Organization) used to persist new accounts created by the Application or Organization, or null if no accountStore has been designated.
      AccountStore getDefaultGroupStore()
      Returns the AccountStore used to persist new groups created by the Application or Organization, or null if no accountStore has been designated.
      void setDefaultAccountStore(AccountStore accountStore)
      Sets the AccountStore (either a Group, Organization or a Directory) used to persist new accounts created by the Application or Organization.
      void setDefaultGroupStore(AccountStore accountStore)
      Sets the AccountStore (a Directory) that will be used to persist new groups created by the Application or Organization.

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultAccountStore

        AccountStore getDefaultAccountStore()
        Returns the AccountStore (either a Group, a Directory or an Organization) used to persist new accounts created by the Application or Organization, or null if no accountStore has been designated.

        Because Applications and Organizations are not AccountStores, they delegate to an Organization, Group or Directory when creating accounts; this method returns the AccountStore to which the Application or Organization delegate the actual storage of new accounts.

        Directory or Group?

        As Organization, Group and Directory are sub-interfaces of AccountStore, you can determine which of the three is returned by using the Visitor design pattern. For example: 

         AccountStore accountStore = application.getDefaultAccountStore();
 accountStore.accept(new AccountStoreVisitor() {

     public void visit(Directory directory) {
         //the accountStore is a Directory
     }

     public void visit(Group group) {
         //the accountStore is a Group;
     }

     public void visit(Organization organization) {
         //the accountStore is an Organization;
     }
 };
        Returns:
        the AccountStore (which will be either a Group, Organization or Directory) used to persist new accounts created by the Account Store Holder (Application or Organization), or null if no accountStore has been designated. Organizations don't actually store Accounts, instead, they delegate the actual storage to their own internal defaultAccountStore. Therefore, Organizations can be seen as a virtual AccountStores.
        Since:
        0.9

      • setDefaultAccountStore

        void setDefaultAccountStore(AccountStore accountStore)
        Sets the AccountStore (either a Group, Organization or a Directory) used to persist new accounts created by the Application or Organization.

        Because Applications and Directories are not AccountStores, they delegate to a Group or Directory when creating accounts; this method returns the AccountStore to which the Application or Organization delegate new account persistence.

        Parameters:
        accountStore - the AccountStore (which will be either a Group or Directory) used to persist new accounts created by the Application or Directory

      • getDefaultGroupStore

        AccountStore getDefaultGroupStore()
        Returns the AccountStore used to persist new groups created by the Application or Organization, or null if no accountStore has been designated. Stormpath's current REST API requires this to be a Directory. However, this could be a Group in the future, so do not assume it is always a Directory if you want your code to be function correctly if/when this support is added. Avoid casting the returned value directly to a Directory: use the Visitor pattern as explained below.

        Because Applications, Organizations and Directories are not AccountStores, they delegate to a Group or Directory when creating accounts; this method returns the AccountStore to which the Application or Organization delegate new account persistence.

        Organization, Directory or Group?

        As Organization, Group and Directory are sub-interfaces of AccountStore, you can determine which of the three is returned by using the Visitor design pattern. For example: 

         AccountStore groupStore = organization.getDefaultGroupStore();
 groupStore.accept(new AccountStoreVisitor() {

     public void visit(Directory directory) {
         //groupStore is a Directory
     }

     public void visit(Group group) {
         //groupStore is a Group;
     }

     public void visit(Organization organization) {
         //groupStore is an Organization;
     }
 };
        Again, in practice, Stormpath's current REST API requires this to be a Directory. However, this could be a Group in the future, so do not assume it will always be a Directory if you want your code to be forward compatible; use the Visitor pattern and do not cast directly to a Directory.
        Returns:
        the AccountStore (which will be either a Group or Directory) used to persist new groups created by the Application or Organization, or null if no accountStore has been designated.
        Since:
        0.9

      • setDefaultGroupStore

        void setDefaultGroupStore(AccountStore accountStore)
        Sets the AccountStore (a Directory) that will be used to persist new groups created by the Application or Organization. Stormpath's current REST API requires this to be a Directory. However, this could be a Group in the future, so do not assume it is always a Directory if you want your code to be function correctly if/when this support is added.

        Because Applications and Directories are not AccountStores, they delegate to a Group or Directory when creating accounts; this method returns the AccountStore to which the Application or Organization delegate new account persistence.

        Parameters:
        accountStore - the AccountStore (which will be either a Group, Organization or Directory) used to persist new groups created by the Application or Organization.
